title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 May 2014 - XWiki
content:
<synth\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:12 <synth\_> hello  
01:09 <abusenius> has quit  
01:11 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
01:26 <abusenius> has quit  
01:46 <synth\_> could anyone lend some assistance? i'm getting an error when installing xwiki using the walkthrough: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT#HUsingMySQL ; my errors: http://sprunge.us/fDSh?txt  
03:08 <synth\_> nevermind, fixed it by running mysqladmin -u root -pCURRENTPASSWORD password ''  
03:40 <D-Spair> has quit  
03:46 <synth\_> so during the initial setup process on ubuntu, i got this error: http://pastebin.com/5TcDQfTQ and when trying to refresh the page, i get: http://i.imgur.com/oJbQXWg.png  
03:54 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki

04:16 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
04:28 <Denis> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:28 <D-Spair> has quit  
05:33 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
05:46 <junix659> hey all, is XEM depricated and should i install Xwiki Enterprise installer - generic?  
06:05 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
06:38 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
06:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:24 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <mflorea> has quit  
08:52 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:56 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:56 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <D-Spair> has quit  
09:56 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <bernar\_w> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <vmassol> good morning  
10:06 <vierfzweievieraz> has left #xwiki  
10:06 <vmassol> anyone remembers how to use the component script service from velocity to pass a Type for getInstance? Do we have a  Converter for string —> Type? (can't find one)  
10:06 <vmassol> tmortagne: any idea?  
10:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: "we" don't but maybe beanutils does  
10:09 <tmortagne> there is a String -> Class for sure at least  
10:09 <vmassol> it doesn't seem to work for Type  
10:09 <vmassol> right now I can't find a way to use it from velocity which is strange  
10:10 <tmortagne> I don't think we are using it from velocity very often  
10:10 <vmassol> it would be strange that I didn't handle the velocity side  
10:10 <vmassol> when I introduced the CSS  
10:10 <vmassol> can't find any doc! :)  
10:10 <vmassol> (was trying to fix this actually)  
10:11 <tmortagne> AFAIK you introduced this script service mostly to make easier getting the CM from groovy  
10:11 <vmassol> well right now there's no permission check anyway in the CSS  
10:11 <vmassol> yes probabmy  
10:11 <vmassol> so not having to use groovy is actually danregous  
10:11 <vmassol> ATM  
10:11 <tmortagne> it's not very hard to write a String -> Type converter anyway  
10:11 <vmassol> yes but that's a security hole  
10:11 <vmassol> if we don't add some permission checks  
10:12 <tmortagne> of course we have permission check  
10:12 <tmortagne> don't forget that we have API taking class in legacy  
10:12 <tmortagne> se it would already be a security hole  
10:13 <vmassol> ah yes we do  
10:13 <vmassol> it' calls getSM  
10:13 <vmassol> which has the check  
10:13 <vmassol> pfewww :)  
10:13 <vmassol> so we just need the Type converter and we're good  
10:13 <tmortagne> vmassol: if you are talking about getInstance method they are not public  
10:13 <tmortagne> your issue is not a converter issue  
10:14 <tmortagne> you can't use those method from Velocity  
10:14 <tmortagne> (no idea why they are not public, don't make much sense to me)  
10:14 <vmassol> oh they're not public, I was sure I had them public  
10:14 <vmassol> when I created them  
10:14 <vmassol> hmm maybe a stupid mistake  
10:14 <tmortagne> it looks like public method javadoc at least  
10:15 <vmassol> they were meant to be public  
10:15 <tmortagne> but those methodes are useless  
10:15 <tmortagne> you have them in CM already  
10:15 <vmassol> "XWIKI-7839: Make Component Manager accessible as a Component Script Service\* Add shortcut for ease of use for the main use case"  
10:15 <vmassol> they are the "shortcut" I mentioned  
10:15 <vmassol> so indeed the missing public keyword is a mistake  
10:16 <vmassol> they are not useless  
10:16 <vmassol> they are shortcuts  
10:17 <vmassol> I agree that the gain is not that big but well....  
10:17 <vmassol> ah actuzally  
10:17 <vmassol> they're wrongly implemented  
10:18 <vmassol> they shouldn't throw an exception but always return null  
10:18 <tmortagne> in that case it's certainly not very big since you can't use them :)  
10:18 <vmassol> fixing them  
10:18 <tmortagne> yes in Velocity world it's nicer to return null and store the exception somwhere  
10:18 <vmassol> with public + return null  
10:18 <cjd> $errno  
10:18 <cjd> I dare you xD  
10:23 <vmassol> tmortagne: btw being able to get a Class/Type object from velocity is a security hole, that's why we have the secure uberspector…  
10:24 <tmortagne> vmassol: you can't get a Class/Type from velocity, you can pass one  
10:24 <tmortagne> to get one you would need a method that return one  
10:27 <tmortagne> by the way even if you find a method to get you a Class it would be unusable because of the security uberspector  
10:27 <vmassol> yep  
10:35 <bernar\_w> has quit  
10:52 <vmassol> tmortagne: actually they are usable from groovy  
10:52 <vmassol> I've tested it and it works fine  
10:53 <cjd> groovy can access private methods/classes/everything  
10:55 <tmortagne> vmassol: should be made more clear then since when you look at the javadoc and see @since 4.0 you think your velocity code will work in 4.0 too  
10:55 <vmassol> yep doing it  
11:31 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:19 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:24 <evalica> has quit

16:37 <kaisen> has quit  
16:55 <lucaa> has quit  
17:19 <sdumitriu> has quit  
17:23 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:58 <cjd> Question about the EM: If I install a jar extension on a subwiki then install the same extension on another subwiki, what happens?  
18:02 <cjd> nvm pretty sure I know what's happening  
18:07 <tmortagne> cjd: each wiki has it's own classloader  
18:07 <tmortagne> (and related ComponentManager)  
18:07 <cjd> ok, is there a way to only allow certain extensions to be loaded at the farm level?  
18:08 <tmortagne> you have two kind of install when on main wiki, install and install on farm  
18:08 <tmortagne> if you want you jar to be in the root extension CL and root CM use install on farm  
18:08 <tmortagne> s/you/your/  
18:13 <andreic> has quit  
18:38 <cjd> has quit  
19:55 <mflorea> has quit  
20:37 <tmortagne> has quit  
21:00 <Denis> has quit  
21:18 <synth\_> hello  
21:24 <vmassol> has quit  
21:31 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
21:44 <synth\_> is there an easy way to completely remove xwiki and reinstall from scratch? i messed up and deleted the xwiki space and now everything is messed up. i tried adding the administration extension but i still can't get everything working the way that it was before and i'd just like to start over  
21:45 <synth\_> i tried sudo apt-get remove xwiki-enterprise-tomcat7-mysql and then reinstalled it but everything is still broken  
22:27 <junix659> has joined #xwiki  
22:28 <lucaa> has quit  
22:34 <junix659> hey guys, got a question for you, will Xwiki 6.0 be available for community edition any time soon?  
22:36 <junix659> also, what is the difference between a Workspace and a Space?  
22:36 <junix659> does the hieracrchy go Workspace -> Space -> PAge?  
23:04 <tillo> has quit  
23:05 <lynxt> has quit  
23:20 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
23:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki
